div.p: ADULT who WORKS IN a PUBLIC OFFICE OR IN A PUBLIC FUNCTION.
1. Officials are referred to as shì 士 and daì fū 大夫. The word shì 士 can also include daì fū 大夫, therefore the term is often used for a whole body of officials.
2. Dà fū 大夫 "notables" is a general formal term for high officials.
3. Lì 吏 refers to officials in charge of concrete practical matters, often policing and the like.
4. Gōng 工 can be used as a general term for clerks.
5. Yǒu sī 有司 can refer to a person in charge of an office.
6. Guān 官 refers quite generally to the persons in charge of an office.
7. Shì zhě 仕者 refers to any person in public employment of any kind.
8. Lǎo 老 originally politely referred to higher officials (>gōng 公, >qīng 卿, >dài fū 大夫 ), therefore it came to be used as a general term referring to high officials.
9. Yuán 員 originally refers to officials as counted units, and the word came to be used as a general term for officials.
HUANG JINGUI 2006
GOVERNMENT/LAW 5.
掾，諸曹事務的主掌者，佐官之通稱；
與屬相對時，掾為正，屬為副。
史，文書類佐助屬官的通稱；一般史、掾通用，當史與掾並置時，則史位於掾下，為掾下的文書。
公務員
勤務員
辦事員
官員
職員
幹部
員司
欽差大臣 refers to an imperial official on an official mission.
One could add a huge number of terms of this sort here, of course.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung
中國文化背景八千詞 Zhongguo wenhua beijing ba qian ci
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

entry.def: Shì 仕 is a permanent employee of some status, normally a literate person.

sense.def: employed official, a person in a regular official capacity
serve as an official; hold a public appointment
enter official employment; obtain an official position

entry.def: Liáo 僚/寮 can also refer to the lesser officials.
Liáo 僚/寮 can also refer to the lesser officials.

sense.def: official; ERYA: colleague, person working in the same guān 官 "office"

entry.def: Shǐ 史 is an official in charge of records and documents.

sense.def: historian; archivist; official (e.g. in charge of milfoil divination); diviner

entry.def: Sī 司 is a general term used in names of offices, and expressing responsility for something.

sense.def: one who takes official care of a some business> officer (SHU)

entry.def: Lì 吏 refers to officials in charge of concrete practical matters, often policing and the like.

sense.def: generally an official of any undistinguished rank; executive officer, executive official ZUO Cheng 2: high official; military official; later: minor official

entry.def: Yuán 員 originally refers to officials as counted units, and the word came to be used as a general term for officials.
Officials are referred to as shì 士 and daì fū 大夫. The word shì 士 can also include daì fū 大夫, therefore the term is often used for a whole body of officials.

sense.def: person belonging to the official class, freeman; official

entry.def: Qiáng 嬙 was a court female officer.
Guān 官 refers quite generally to the persons in charge of an office.

Zǎi 宰 refers to the position of the head of a senior household in early times, in charge of the various huàn 宦. The title was also used in the imperial hierarchy as a vague bureaucratic title, translatable perhaps as "political secretary".
Shǔ 屬 refers to the assistant of a leading official.

sense.def: supporting officer, official belonging to a faction or party

entry.def: Gōng 工 can be used as a general term for clerks.

sense.def: dignitary (in 公族 "dignitary in the ducal clan")
official in charge of (e.g. music); person in charge of (someone else)

entry.def: Jùn 畯 was in antiquity an official in charge of agriculture.
Lǎo 老 originally politely referred to higher officials (>gōng 公, >qīng 卿, >dài fū 大夫), therefore it came to be used as a general term referring to high officials.

sense.def: HAN: official with direct access to the court, official of a certain rank
the various officials 卿，大夫，士
person of any kind (officials or non-officials)
official in charge of public orders and decrees

entry.def: 6. Shì zhě 仕者 refers to any person in public employment of any kind.

sense.def: public employee of any rank; often specifically: public official of lower rank

entry.def: Bīng jiā 兵家 refers to military expert(s).

sense.def: scribal, clerk-like, characteristic of a minor official 刀筆（之）吏
Steward of the Right by the name of Npr
official in charge of the calendar

entry.def: Zhí shì 執事 is a general term for each high official.

sense.def: the officials in charge; the person in charge

entry.def: Shì rén 士人 can be also used as a general term referring to the whole body of officials.

sense.def: men of importance in public life

entry.def: Dà fū 大夫 "notables" is a general formal term for high officials.

sense.def: the dignitaries, the high dignitaries (not to be confused with notions of hereditary nobility)
dignitary, high dignitary Npr; (the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)
"dignitary"(the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)
dignitary of Npl (the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)
a notable; a dignitary (the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)
dignitary Npr (the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)
a notable, a dignitary, a grandee (whose name is not given) (the reference is to official status rather than hereditary nobility)

entry.def: Guān lì 官吏 is a general term for employes of various offices.
Guān zhí 官職 generally refers to high officials.

sense.def: officials of any kind; officials of the various kinds; officials with their assigned duties
head of an administrative office> senior official
senior officials below the ministerial level
minor ceremonial official; minor ceremonial usher

entry.def: Yǒu sī 有司 can refer to a person in charge of an office.

sense.def: officials in charge 有司皆曰 (usually the reference is definite and plural, when the word is not used predicatively)
official in charge of the fire brigade
be in charge of official tasks
head gardener; superintendant of ruler’s own garden & fields; head of the hunting expedition in a park ZUO: : 使甸人獻麥 He made his head gardener present some barley.

entry.def: Bǎi guān 百官 originally refers to the officials lower then ministers >qing 卿; later the term came to used as a general term for the whole body of ofiicials.

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Official Titles in Imperial China

sense.def: officials of the state who are relatives of the 大夫 dignitaries
invocator. prayer-maker; communicator with the spirits; ritual recorder; ritual officer
archaic, OBI etc: the many officials
the officials (of an age of decline)
definite: all the various officials below the top level of the adminstration 臣，大夫
definite: all the various officials below the top level of the adminstration 臣，大夫
the senior officials; all the senior officials
senior official at the 縣 level: District Officials
senior official at the 縣 level: District Officials
official travel companion; travel official on the right
the chief of the office; the lord of the house
the local officials of the contextually determined place
